Diamond_Bar.Galster Wilderness Park Nature Center:
The Galster Wilderness Park Nature Center is a small museum and educational center set in Galster Wilderness Park, a 42-acre (170,000 m2) wilderness park located on the north slope of the San Jose Hills in the San Gabriel Valley, California. It is operated by the San Gabriel Mountains Regional Conservancy in partnership with the City of West Covina, California.
The center is named after Emil S. and Gladys Galster, who deeded the park to the City of West Covina in 1971.
